img.alt: Spinning sphere (disc, cylinder) is lowered on a a horizontal surface

problem.p: A thin loop of mass \(m\) and radius \(r\) is given the angular speed \(\omega_0\) and is then lowered vertically on a horizontal surface as shown. After an initial period of slipping, the loop begins to roll without slipping at a constant velocity.
problem.part:
What is the best description of the motion of the loop before slipping ends?
The translational speed increases while rotational speed increases
The translational speed decreases while rotational speed increases
The translational speed increases while rotational speed decreases
The translational speed decreases while rotational speed decreases

Find the speed \(v\) of the loop after slipping stops.
v =\(\omega_0r\)/2 v =\(\omega_0r\)/3 v =\(2\omega_0r\)/3 v =\(\omega_0r\)/5 v =\(3\omega_0r\)/5

Find the amount of heat \(Q\) generated before the slipping of the loop stops. Note: the amount of heat can be found as the difference between the initial and the final kinetic energy of the loop.
Q=m\((\omega_0r)^2\)/4 Q=m\((\omega_0r)^2\)/3 Q=m\((\omega_0r)^2\)/2 Q=2m\((\omega_0r)^2\)/3 Q=m\((\omega_0r)^2\)/8
